comment: lectures before class are super long and don't really help at all, most people zone out and we ended up confused once it was time to start lab. I had to go to his office hours twice a week, every week because he wasn't really helpful over email and he is a tough grader. he's nice, but he tends to over explain things, so I wouldn't recommend.

Great experience with his class. He's very friendly and approachable. Checks on students during experiments and is happy to answer questions. Lectures at beginning of lab are long but very helpful/informational. Seems like a hard grader at first, but once you understand his expectations it is not hard to do well. Definitely recommend taking him!

Dr. Hasha lectures for 1-2 hrs before lab, the lectures are difficult to learn from & it was frustrating. But then, whenever I needed help, he never hesitated to help me, he's understanding & genuinely wants students to get the content. If you want a professor who cares about you, he's will, and is lenient with you if you show that you are trying.

Dr.Hasha is very willing to help you understand the concepts if you aren't getting it but omg his grading is the worst. He grades so harshly. I accidently put a negative in one of my equations and he took off 20 points. He wouldn't let me redo them either. Most people in this class either got a 60 or a 100 on the lab reports, no in between.

Super knowledgeable. Lectures at the beginning of class can be mind numbing for non stem kids. Lab report grades are stricter than 1211 but really help you learn. Very accessible and helpful. Wish I could take him for more.

Overall I enjoyed Dr.Hasha as a lab teacher. He gives a lecture at the beginning of lab going over the topic but this lecture can take up half of the lab time so don't schedule a class right after the lab is supposed to end because you will most likely be staying late to finish the lab. He is a nice man who is looking for social interaction.

Pre-lab quizzes have 3 attempts no lockdown & no post-lab quizzes. You turn in your lab reports at the beginning of every class and he only grades the purpose+procedures in your lab notebook. He's extremely understanding if you're late to the lab or do not have your report with you. At the beginning of every lab, he goes over procedures too.

He's a good lab teacher overall. LabFlow is what makes it hard. He does a powerpoint before the activity each lab so that we understand what we're doing and what our data will mean. The slides are very helpful when doing the report on LabFlow. He's not amazing but I would recommend him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lab lectures are well prepared and clear. He gives you all the calculations with explanations during his lecture. He responds quickly to emails. He explains concepts very well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Hasha is an awesome guy, he has short but helpful prelab lectures and he is willing to work with you. He is a bit of a tough grader but he is very fair, I never had to argue over my grades. He is available outside of class and super nice. I would take him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easiest lab professor I've had so far. His instruction is very clear and easy to follow. He's also always willing to help! During our time online for COVID-19, he never took more than a few hours to respond to my emails and he was always so encouraging and helpful. Great professor for this lab.
